Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Empire of the Sun
Description:
The Empire of the Sun controls a large island chain far to the east, across the raging sea. They are led by an Emperor who the common folk believe is descended from a divine ancestory. The Emperor is reclusive and mysterious and most of the country is ruled by a warrior aristocracy called the Samurai, or those who serve.
The senior and most powerful samurai in the Emperor's service is his personal warlord called the Shogun. The Shogun does not lead troops in the field but coordinates strategy, administration and logistics among the Daimyo or clan lords. These Daimyo take to the field of battle under the auspices of the Shogun and Emperor. They field their own personal retinues of samurai and ashigaru warriors and lead them into battle. For larger battles many Daimyo will come together and elect a temporary warlord to lead them in battle for that day though this rarely happens.
The Empire has sent trade ships across the Raging Sea and made contact with the Leonid Empire and Sea Elves and does a brisk trade with these nations exchanging rare spices for tin and iron to make steel. The Trade expeditions have also discovered the Land of the Dead and have reported this to the Emperor.
The Emperor now believes that the entire continent to be tainted with the touch of ncromancy and decay. He has sent a large invasion fleet to cleanse the lands and extend his domain into this new world.

Get Some! Fantasy Warfare is about getting your models out and playing an enjoyable wargame for a couple of hours with your buddies. It is NOT about WAAC (Winning at all Costs) but about designing an army that fits your collection and play style as well as the background for the Universe you are playing in. Tactics and Command should play the pivotal roles in the battel as well as a little bit of Luck and NOT pimped out units. Armies should be a mix of Melee, Ranged and Magical/Monsterous units. Each should check some of the power of the others in the rock, paper, scissors kind of way, which is similar to actual warfare.

–description from the publisher

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Forces of Carthage
Description:
Carthage was founded by nobles from the Phoenician city of Tyre and from Cyprus. From the start it was a complete and independent city on a spot with favorable access to important resources such as clay and sea salt. Carthage in North Africa then became the cradle and center of the Punic state which spread across the Mediterranean. Carthage's military traditions showed its Phoenician roots and reflected native Libyan and Greek influences.
It has traditionally been argued that Carthage was a peaceful city of merchants or a brutal colonial power and both theories were rather dependent upon modern perceptions. Almost all approaches towards Carthage have in common the fact that they do not look at Carthaginian policy-making as such, but rather its structure in a fundamental contrast to that of Rome. However, the polis Carthage was over the course of several centuries the dominant power in the Western Mediterranean and could establish its authority over large territories which were also deeply influenced by the Punic culture.
Ancient authors tend to stress the reliance of Carthage on foreign mercenaries. However, the term 'mercenary' is misleading when applied to the African and Spanish recruits, i.e. from areas controlled by Carthage. They were comparable to Roman Auxilia though Carthage did also employ mercenaries in the true sense as well. These units were mostly deployed in the expeditionary armies overseas, while in Africa Punic militias formed the backbone of the troops. Units were generally segregated by ethnicity which was also a criterion for the respective specialisation.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Free Cities
Description:
The Free Cities are usually ports and run by an oligarchy of wealthy merchants. As such most of their forces are mercenaries with a few specialist units native to that city. They tend to rely on formations of pikemen, crossbowmen and various light and heavy cavalry units. They use few warmachines and rarely take them on campaign. Thier mercenary forces tend to wear lighter armor, make extensive use of shields and invariably have low morale but strong leadership. Wanering Wizards often hire out their services to reputable mercenary captains in order to further their arcane studies.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare  – The Gunpowder Kingdoms
Description:
The Gunpowder Kingdoms rely on the use of firearms and cannon mostly to defend their territories. Since the discovery of gunpowder they have abandoned the use of the heaviest armor but they still use a steel breastplate, open helmet and greaves. They use formations of Pikemen supported by llightly armored Gunners and heavy cannon. They still use fast cavalry for scouting and a few small formations of heavier cavalry but these are becoming more rare. Becasue of their devout religious beliefs they abandoned magic long ago and occasionally conduct witchhunts for magic users of any sort.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Infernal Legions
Description:
The Demon Queen sits upon her Throne of Bones and sends for legions of devils and deluded men to sow strife and violence in the world of ordinary men. She is an ancient creature born at the dawn of creation and constantly at war with the forces of Law and Order.
The Abyss lives outside but alongside the world of mortals and occasionally passageways between the two worlds open up. When this happens the forces of the Abyss pour forth and rush across the land slaughtering all who oppose them. Infernal Legions overthrow kingdoms and place Pit Lords upon the thrones of Men, Elves, and Dwarves.
It is said that in the end times near the Coming of the Apocalypse the forces of the Abyss will ravage the land and wage a thousand year war against the Celestial Host and their mortal allies.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Legions of Rome
Description:
When the Legions where swept into the vortex that deposited them into this strange new world they had only the knowledge they carried with them inside their own heads. They could make or repair banded mail armor, gladius sword and pugio daggers, pilum javelins, spears, care and feeding of thier horses and how to build seige engines like the scorpion ballista and onager catapults from nothing but raw timber.

A Legion is an organization created for one thing, slaughter. It is a well oiled engine of destruction. At it's core are three lines of heavy infantry supported by light cavalry, archers, slingers, javelin armed scouts and lots of siege engines. It is meant for long campaigns and its legionnaires are a rough a tumble crowd or ill educated plebs led by the educated Patricians and kept in line by hard, disciplined Centurians.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Northmen
Description:
The Northmen are a fast moving sea-borne raiding force that terrorizes the coasts of the Northern Ocean and beyond. They are excellent seamen and have been known to show up on the other side of the continents looking for plunder and slaves. They are decently armored and wield the frightening Great Axe which has become so closely associated with the Northmen that coastal villagers simply refer to them as the Sea Axes or just the Sax.

The Northmen fight in a shieldwall with spears and axes. They are supported by more heavily armored Huscarls and Thegns who tackle the toughest enemies while the young Drang seek to attack from a flank or behind. Berserkers group together and range out in front of the main battleline to disrupt the enemy plans. Hunters pepper the enemy with bowfire from behind the lines. On rare occasion a force will field Battle Troll mercenaries or Jotun thralls who by themselves can turn a battle completely around.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Orcs
Description:
Orcs value strength and this can be found in their weapons and armor. They field the heaviest armor they can manufacture or loot and the heaviest weapons they can find. They ride fierce beasts and intimidate even trolls into doing their bidding. They are fierce and brutal warriors with simple tactics, get stuck in as quickly as possible.

Orcs use infantry, cavalry, chariots and monsters in thier armies. The core of any orc horde is the orcs themselves which come in all sizes and are invariably covered in armor and weapons. Their goals are simple kill everything and loot what they can.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Persian Empire
Description:
The Achaemenid Empire, also known as the First Persian Empire, was founded in the 6th century BC by Cyrus the Great who overthrew the Median confederation. The empire expanded to eventually rule over significant portions of the ancient world which at around 500 BC stretched from the Indus Valley in the east, to Thrace and Macedon on the northeastern border of Greece, making it the biggest empire the world had yet seen. The Persian Empire would eventually control Egypt as well. It was ruled by a series of monarchs who unified its disparate tribes and nationalities by constructing a complex network of roads.
At the height of its power after the conquest of Egypt, the empire spanned three continents: Asia, Africa and Europe. It is noted in Western history as the antagonist foe of the Greek city states during the Greco-Persian Wars and for instituting infrastructures such as a postal system, road systems, and the usage of an official language, Aramaic, throughout its territories. The empire had a centralised, bureaucratic administration under the King and a large professional army and civil services, inspiring similar developments in later empires.The delegation of power to local governments eventually weakened the king's central authority, causing resources to be expended in attempts to subdue local rebellions. This accounts for the dis-unification of the region by the time Alexander the Great invaded Persia in 334 BC.

They have trading posts and small city states on the shores of the Middle Sea and every other Sea or Ocean in the Known World. They are explorers and sometimes raiders or pirates.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Shadow Elves
Description:
Shadow Elves are a murderous race and delight in the suffering of others. They prefer to wage war up close and personal where they can experience firsthand the suffering of their opponents. Thier physical beauty belies a savage and sinister nature. A Shadow Elf Enclave is a place of torment and pain for pleasure and the fulfillment of dark desires.

The Shadow Elf military forces are primarily made up of formations of spearmen flanked by cultists and cavalry and supported from the rear by archers and bolt throwers. Shock troops such as the Headsmen and War Hydras are kept in reserve and committed to battle when the line is close to breaking or to shatter an enemy formation. Cavalry and scouts attack from the flanks and rear while pirate allies strike from hiding.

It seems the more the Kingdoms of the west fight the undead hordes the more of their slain soldiers return to fight against their one time comrades in arms. Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – The Wild Elves
Description:
The Wild Elves belong to the great forests that spread across the Known World. They make their towns and villages high among the greatest trees connected by wood and rope bridges. They are wardens of the forest and protectors of the wild creatures within those forests. They are a peaceful folk unless the tranquility of their forests are threatened with logging, poaching or evil intentions.

The Wild Elves use vary little armor and prefer to strike from afar with thier longbows. They are just as skilled in the arts of the blade and spear but save those for when the enemy pushes through a storm of arrows. They have also on occasion used forest spirits, giant eagles or even dragons to defend the forest.

Name: Get Some!: Fantasy Warfare – Wyrmlings
Description:
The Wyrmlings inhabit the swamps of the Known World in small numbers with perhaps only a sinlge tribe controlling a small swamp within a larger kingdom of another race. Only in the great southern forest on the banks of the Eleam River system do the Wyrmlings exist in great numbers. They control a vast empire along that great river and its surrounding rainforest.

The Wyrmlings use the massive sauroid creatures that dwell within the Great Eleam River basin and other smaller swampy areas around the Known World. Wyrmlings are generally of human height but there are variations such as the smaller Lizardkin who use cameleon like skin to hide among the underbrush and ambush unwary prey and the huge Black Croks who can tear a man in half without blinking. Thier bodies have a natural armor but they make use of shields for extra protection. Weapons tend to be made from natural materials such as bone, teeth and stone.

Name: Get Some!: Future Warfare – Synod Army List
Description:
The armies of the Universal Synod ofWorlds are vast beyond comprehension. They control millions of worlds. They are far from a unified people but a confederation of thousands of smaller empires, republics, federations and states. They are ruled by decentralized form of republic whereby sectors send representatives to the Universal Althing to decide
matters of relevance to every being in the Universe.
The military, at least on a local level, need unity of command. For that reason the Synod delegates a representative from that sector to coordinate military efforts within that sector. Military units are often drawn from local planets and given more advanced training if necessary. Since most of the species within the Synod ofWorlds are pacifistic the burden of fighting often falls on the Consensus of Artificial Systems or just the Consensus.
The Consensus are advanced artificial lifeforms that grew out of Synod artificial intelligences. Their worlds are massive factories and research laboratories. They have taken up the mantle of military protectors and provided the backbone for almost all of the Synod Military formations. Artificial Intelligences specifically designed for military thought lead armies of nonsentient drones and vehicles. This is done to protect the people of the Synod from the horrors of warfare and contagion of the Fallen races. Races within the Synod, known as the Chosen, often provide specialist units or leaders to supplement the powerful but inetectually limited drone forces.

The following pdf will provide unit descriptions and game statistics for a typical Synod Military Formation.

Name: Get Some!: Future Warfare – Terran Army List
Description:
The Terran Legions is a joint effort funded by the United States, the European Union, Australia, Japan and India. It uses shared equipment, language and a shared organization to create a unified Terran Defense Force and Terran Expeditionary Legions. It offers citizenship in any of the alliance countries for a five year term of service in the Legions. The Legions take volunteers from any country and have recruiting offices in most countries.
The Legion concept has worked wonderfully and in the last three years since the Centauri and Sentai campaigns 125 Legions have been raised and equipped. They have been training on the new equipment and learning to work together. Legions have been moved to Mars, Botany Bay, Plymouth Rock and Sentai.

Name: Get Some!: Army Design Special Rules
Description:
Get Some! is a game for the table top wargamer. As such we recognize the need for some special rules to add some flavor to your homebrew armies. Here is a short list of Special Rules you can use with your army. There a few restrictions on the use of Special Rules:


     You have 10 "Points" with which to buy special rules for your army. You can have less than 10 "Points" but not more.
     You can only use a special rule 3 times in your entire list.
     A unit can only have as many special rules as its size characteristic.


How to use these rules.

When you are designing a unit you simply add the points value for the rule to your unit cost BEFORE you multiply for size, confidence level, command skill or mastery level. So the rules become part of your base cost just like weapons, armor and skill. OK on that note, here are the special rules and thier descriptions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighting Vehicles I: Synod Military Forces in the Sol Sector
Description:
The armies of the Universal Synod of Worlds are vast beyond comprehension. They control millions of worlds. They are far from a unified people but a confederation of thousands of smaller empires, republics, federations and states. They are ruled by de-centralized form of republic whereby sectors send representatives to the Universal Althing to decide matters of relevance to every being in the Universe.
The military, at least on a local level, need unity of command. For that reason the Synod delegates a representative from that sector to coordinate military efforts within that sector. Name: Fighting Vehicles Supplamental: Additional Terran Warships
Description:
The Supplamental Fleet Series
The Supplemental series is meant to provide new units to use in your games. Some of these units will be unique with their own history and a specific statline that is unique to that unit. 
The War against the Synod and their Fallen allies is so vast it is actually numerous wars and battles within the mind bogglingly vast holdings of the Universal Synod of Worlds. 
Within this enourmous framework literally anything can happen. There is room for any species or government with any level of technology you can imagine.
Some of the PDFs in the series will be additions to already established factions and others will be for completely new factions that are not connected to the struggle between the Terrans and their Allies against the Synod in the Sol Sector. 
Marauders, Pirates, Interstellar Conquistadores, Mercenaries and Corporate Military Forces all fight for planets and resources within the galaxies controlled by the Synod. New races, new ships, new ground forces and new rules will all be placed in the context of these supplemental PDFs.

Terran Fleet Units
In this supplement are some fleet designs that did not make it into the Campaign Books but will be useful and will most likely show up in future Campaigns.

—description from the publisher

The War against the Synod and their Fallen allies is so vast it is actually numerous wars and battles within the mind bogglingly vast holdings of the Universal Synod of Worlds. Within this enormous framework literally anything can happen. There is room for any species or government with any level of technology you can imagine.
Some of the PDFs in the series will be additions to already established factions and others will be for completely new factions that are not connected to the struggle between the Terrans and their Allies against the Synod in the Sol Sector. Marauders, Pirates, Interstellar Conquistadores, Mercenaries and Corporate Military Forces all fight for planets and resources within the galaxies controlled by the Synod. New races, new ships, new ground forces and new rules will all be placed in the context of these supplemental PDFs.

Synod Merchant Fleet
In this supplement we get some SSDs for those merchant ships that form the lifeblood of any stellar nation. Most of the ships here are Synod in origin but can be converted easily enough by replacing beam batteries with railguns or more PDS. Everything from Huge Bulk Freighters to small fast corporate couriers are presented here.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighting Vehicles IV: Ghost Fleet Military Forces in the Sol Sector
Description:
Ghost Invasion Forces
The Synod is a huge collection of various races. Some of these races started life as artificial intelligences. These intelligences eventually grew and evolved and became new life. These early intelligences wished to be treated as any other sentient being and took the Synod to the courts.
After many years threading their way through the court system and eventually winning in a landmark decision the artificial intelligences who could pass certain tests were allowed to become full citizens of the Universal Synod of Worlds.
They called their new race, the Consensus of Minds or just the Consensus. They claimed dead worlds that none of the other races wished to invest in. These worlds were often rich in metals and cilicates. Eventually the Consensus became the premier operator of mines and factories in the Synod. They churned out legions of bots and drones designed to operate for extended periods in hostile and dangerous environments.
The Consensus spread throughout the Synod and became very influential in all areas of business and manufacturing. Entire systems had been turned into vast hives of drones and massive intelligences that controlled them.
Some of these intelligences began showing signs of instability and eventually all communications were lost with some systems. Any ship that entered these ghost systems never returned. They were quarantined and embargoed. No ships were allowed to enter or leave the system. The Ghost systems have slumbered undisturbed for centuries...

....until now

The Ghost forces rely heavily on energy weapons and vast armies of drones. Whether in space or dirtside they seek to overwhelm defending forces with swarms of smaller ships and a phalanx of energy weapons.

The following pdf will provide unit descriptions and game statistics for a typical Ghost Military Formation and their tactics.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighting Vehicles Supplamental: Raiders and Pirates
Description:
The Supplamental Fleet Series
The Supplemental series is meant to provide new units to use in your games. 
Some of these units will be unique with their own history and a specific statline that is unique to that unit. 
The War against the Synod and their Fallen allies is so vast it is actually numerous wars and battles within the mind bogglingly vast holdings of the Universal Synod of Worlds. Within this enourmous framework literally anything can happen. There is room for any species or government with any level of technology you can imagine.
Some of the PDFs in the series will be additions to already established factions and others will be for completely new factions that are not connected to the struggle between the Terrans and their Allies against the Synod in the Sol Sector. Marauders, Pirates, Interstellar Conquistadores, Mercenaries and Corporate Military Forces all fight for planets and resources within the galaxies controlled by the Synod. New races, new ships, new ground forces and new rules will all be placed in the context of these supplemental PDFs.

Raiders and Pirates
In this supplement we delve into the Piratical raiders of the Synod Universe. We will see some of their ships as well as some infantry units so you can run boarding actions in your games as smaller sub-games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighting Vehicles V: Terran Military Forces in the Sol Sector
Description:
The Terran Legions is a joint effort funded by the United States, the European Union, Australia, Japan and India. It uses shared equipment, language and a shared organization to create a unified Terran Defense Force and Terran Expeditionary Legions. It offers citizenship in any of the alliance countries for a five year term of service in the Legions. The Legions take volunteers from any country and have recruiting offices in most countries.
The Legion concept has worked wonderfully and in the last three years since the Centauri and Sentai campaigns 125 Legions have been raised and equipped. They have been training on the new equipment and learning to work together. Legions have been moved to Mars, Botany Bay, Plymouth Rock and Sentai.

Fighting Vehicles V: Terran Military Forces in the Sol Sector will provide unit descriptions and game statistics for a typical Terran Legion and their tactics.

This PDF is required to play through the Ghost War Campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighting Vehicles VI: Aven Military Forces in the Sol Sector
Description:
The Aven prefer to use fast moving, hard hitting but lightly armored forces. They use VTOL based air assault troops, fast GEV tanks and Multi-Mode Fighters. The Aven are natural fighters in urban or mountainous areas as well as the plains. Their use of lightning assaults means they prefer a mobile defense rather than digging in and defending a piece of terrain. The Aven will often mine the key piece of terrain in question and then attack the enemy force from range and try to draw them into chasing the Aven force. If the enemy decides to chase the Aven will pull the enemy force into a series of repeated ambushes by fast moving vehicles while MMF attack from the sky and rear. The enemy force is harrassed until it disperses out of frustration in its inability to bring the Aven to a stand-up fight.

This will provide unit descriptions and game statistics for a typical Aven War Flock and their tactics.

This PDF is required to play through the Ghost War Campaign.

Name: Fighting Vehicles VII: Synod Fleet Units
Description:
The Synod Peace Fleet
The Synod is a vast collective of races who pool resources and information. They have a long history of genetic manipulation and terraforming. Culturally they have grown stagnant and some planets are in the process of breaking away from the Synod of Worlds for various reasons. Most of them by force. The Synod has attempted through genetic manipulation to eradicate warlike and violent behavior among the member species of the Synod. The worlds that break away or refuse membership into the Synod are seen by the Synod's governing body, the Allthing, as a dangerous influence to other worlds. Some worlds who are not fully developed but who show violent, warlike tendencies have been destroyed by unknown means. The universe is littered with the bones of civilizations that have been wiped clean from the planets they once populated.

The following pdf will provide unit descriptions and game statistics for a typical Synod Fleet and their tactics.

This PDF is required to play through the Alpha Centauri and Sentai Campaigns.

—description from the publisher

Name: MACE: Massive Armored Combat Elements – Marks I Through X
Description:
In the universe of Awakening ancient aliens who enforce pacifism on the rest of the senient beings of the universe, the Maces are one of the tools humanity embraces in order to help win a war they could never possibly win. The odds are so stacked against the Terrans and their few allies that it literally boggles the mind. They are up against a six billion year old civilization that spans galaxies and controls millions of worlds. The only thing that stands between the Terrans and annihilation is that the Universal Synod is fighting thousands of such wars against tens of thousands of civilizations and the Synod has never had to fight a war...

...Until now.

The MACE program is designed to build the next generation of armored fighting vehicles for the Terran military in their ongoing fight with the Univesal Synod of Worlds. The earliest Marks grow out of modern main battle tanks and become huge machines of destruction on a planetary scale.

This PDF describes each of the first ten Marks of Mace and provide their Dirtside II combat statistics.

It also provides the Full Thrust stats for two variants of the Mace Combat Transport and Mace Combat Lander spacecraft.

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: Part 1 – The Invasion of Trii'Hom
Description:
The victory in the Sentai system was costly for both sides but managed to buy both space and time to fortify against the inevitable Synod counter strike. The last three years has also allowed the Terran Alliance to strengthen the bonds formed in battle with many of its neighbors and budding allies. Trade between the worlds of the Terran Alliance grows and formal alliance treaties are being ratified by member species and governments.
The Synod meanwhile has fortified its remaining systems and continues to build a large fleet presence in all of its worlds within the sector. Both Hevan's Gate and the Lion's Gate systems are heavily fortified and rumors persist among the Preservation Societies that the Synod has formed agreements with some fallen planets within the sector.
Terran has begun to send out colony ships and the first of many colonies have taken root in some nearby systems. The European Union and Australia together have colonized a planet in the Epsilon Eridani system and named the first colony on the planet Botany Bay. The United States has taken control of Alpha Centauri and Plymouth Rock. The Chinese sent out a colony ealier in the year headed for a planet in the Sirius system. The Wolf 359 system was colonized last year by a conglomerate of Russian, Middle Eastern and African nations financed by a few large multinational corporations. Tau Ceti, Gliese 876 and Sentai have been garrisoned by lage contingents of Alliance troops. Alpha Centauri and Sentai systems have the largest fleet presence as they are directly on the front lines.

Thirteen more scenarios recount the fight for the Trii'hom System against a fleet of Ghost ships.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: Part 2 – Invasion of Sera
Description:
The victory in the Sentai system was costly for both sides but managed to buy both space and time to fortify against the inevitable Synod counter strike. The last three years has also allowed the Terran Alliance to strengthen the bonds formed in battle with many of its neighbors and budding allies. Trade between the worlds of the Terran Alliance grows and formal alliance treaties are being ratified by member species and governments.
The Synod meanwhile has fortified its remaining systems and continues to build a large fleet presence in all of its worlds within the sector. Both Hevan's Gate and the Lion's Gate systems are heavily fortified and rumors persist among the Preservation Societies that the Synod has formed agreements with some fallen planets within the sector.
Terran has begun to send out colony ships and the first of many colonies have taken root in some nearby systems. The European Union and Australia together have colonized a planet in the Epsilon Eridani system and named the first colony on the planet Botany Bay. The United States has taken control of Alpha Centauri and Plymouth Rock. The Chinese sent out a colony ealier in the year headed for a planet in the Sirius system. The Wolf 359 system was colonized last year by a conglomerate of Russian, Middle Eastern and African nations financed by a few large multinational corporations. Tau Ceti, Gliese 876 and Sentai have been garrisoned by lage contingents of Alliance troops. Alpha Centauri and Sentai systems have the largest fleet presence as they are directly on the front lines.

Thirteen more scenarios recount the fight for the Sera System against a fleet of Ghost ships.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: Part 3 – The Battle for Alpha Centauri
Description:
Both Trii'hom and Sera are fully engaged in a life or death ground war and both of their economies are devastated from orbital bombardments and heavy ground fighting. If this Ghost fleet comes through the Kreul system then that will give them three entry points into the Alpha Centauri system. The Alpha Centauri system is the linch-pin for controlling the entire sector and is the gateway to the Sol system and Terra. The Home Fleet is being held back for a counterattack into Alpha Centauri if we lose the system. Our allies are cut off from us and engaged. We are on our own for now.

Thirteen more scenarios recount the fight for the Alpha Centauri System against a fleet of Ghost ships.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ghost War IV: The Helldivers and Myrmidons of the Terran Joint Special Operations Command
Description:
Joint Special
Operations Command
operating in the Ghost
War Campaign

Terran military forces have extensive experience in conducting special warfare operations against each other but when the early battles with the Synod took place they lacked experience in orbital and deep space operations. During the lull in the general fighting for the last three years the Terran Joint Special Operations Command was formed and the world's special forces began the process of integrating into a single command.
Unity of command and training as well as integration of personnel and equipment has allowed the JSOC to start mounting missions into Synod controlled space. With the last five years worth of experience in hand the JSOC have developed new weapons and armor with which to combat the enemies of Earth.
Deep within the JSOC itself is an ultra-black program code named "Myrmidon" which takes quailifying candidates and performs highly experimental cybernetic and neural enhancement surgery. Speed, Strength and Dexterity are significantly enhanced and neural implants are embedded in the subjects brain giving them perfect recall and the ability to directly link with some computer systems. Program Myrmidon has also developed a suit of advance powered armor giving their already deadly soldiers even more speed, protection and firepower.

Six more scenarios and full stats for Terran Helldivers and Myrmidons as well as the backgroud information and equipment for them.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: Part 5 – The Battle for Botany Bay
Description:
Two years ago the Epsilon Eridani system was discovered to have a planet in the "Goldilocks" zone.  The European Union led by Germany and Britain combined with the support of Australia have spent the last two years putting together a colony plan and moving personnel and equipment into the system. The final colony shipment landed six months ago but the majority of the colony is still getting their feet underneath them. The majority of the colony is scattered around the main colony site in small farmsteads linked by solar powered wireless communications and not much else. There are around two hundred thousand colonists on the planet, half of which live in the main colony site, New Dover.

13 more scenarios and background information on the Battle for Botany Bay between the 13th Terran Legion and Task Force Apache against the Ghost Fleet an the Universal Synod of Worlds.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: The Siege of Terra – Part 2: Gaining a Foothold Africa
Description:
The skies of Earth have filled with the bulk of an enemy fleet. Our planetary defenses are fighting for their lives, and ours, to repulse the enemy fleet but they are outnumbered greatly. The cities of Earth are a madhouse of looting, violence and fear. Most bellieve it will be the end of our world but not all. Those who bellieve in the destiny of the human race fight valiantly to protect their homeworld and the families who llive there.
The invasion has not been the blitzkrieg from the skies that everyone feared but a slow and methodical landing of troops and equipment which is letting us mass our forces against each landing. The Intelligence pogs have no more idea what the Ghosts are up than the average line trooper, though rumors fly fast and furioous across the global net.
We know that our forces scattered across the sector will carry on the fight and possibly the genes of the entire human race. But dammit we wanna live just as much as the next race. So we will fight them to our last and hopefuly cost them so much they will think twice about taking us on again.
The Ghosts may be setting us up for a trap, luring out our forces so they can destroy them more easily. Right now the fight is between the orbital stations and the planetary defense forts dirtside. The stations and forts are getting pasted but they are taking down Ghost ships with them. More than we ever expected them to. Word is every crewmen on a station and PDF are getting medals and promotions. Posthumously, of course.
The fleet is sending for aid from our far flung colony worlds though they may not arrive in time to save us. So we must fight for every inch of soil, every ounce of water and every breath of fresh air. We are outnumbered, out-gunned and cornered. We have them right were we want them...

6 more scenarios and background information on the Ghost Fleet's attempt to gain a foothold in Africa during the Siege of Terra.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: The Siege of Terra – Part 1: The Opening Gambit: Australia
Description:
The Ghost Fleet has breached the Alpha Centauri System and a raging battle still continues on its surface. The majority of the Terran Alpha Centauri Fleet has withdrawn to protect the homeworld of humanity. The ruthless Ghost Fleet has doggedly pursued them all the way the the Sol System and is making its way toward the blue and green marble of our mother world.
Fleet personnel have been recalled to their ships and duty posts across the system. Leaves have been cancelled and service men and women wait in lline to get back into orbit or for flgihts to their home bases. Civilian all over the world flee the cities to take refuge in the mountains and deserts in hidden subterranean shelters.
Cities convulse in fear and panic as word spreads of a coming invasion by alien forces. Everywhere on the Earth civilians seek shelter and protection from the coming apocalypse. The roads are clogged with vehicles of all shapes and sizes as people attempt to flee the cities. Citizens arm themselves and hoard food and water in bomb shelters, basements, schools and public buildings.
Thousands die in the panic...

Local militaries worldwide go on their highest alert status and soldiers swarm over vehicles, loading them with ammunition and fuel. Strategic bombers take off an begin a slow circumnavigation of the globe, waiting for the call to bomb any enemy invasion site. Troops move into prepared positions and the new planetary defense forts warm up their reactors and begin running diagnostics on their huge railguns. Orbital Defene Platforms warm up their own guns and begin searching the sky for hostile vessels.
Fortress Earth awaits...

6 more scenarios and background information on the Opening Gambit in the Siege of Terra, the Battle for Australia.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: The Siege of Terra – Part 5: Ride of the Valkyries
Description:
With the loss of Alpha Centauri our logistics chain has been comprimised and we are no longer recieving supplies from Terra. COMSENFLT has ordered the fleet to break anchor and make speed for the Gliese 876 system. Admiral Sorenson expects to meet heavy reistance from Ghost forces still in the Alpha Centauri System. He also expects scouting forces in the Gliese 876, Tau Ceti and Sirius system. Comm traffice from the smaller task groups along the Sentai chain indicates roving squadrons of scouts from the Ghost fleet.
We have had no contact from Terra since the courier ship delivered the news that Terra was under siege. The lack of communication is worrisome and the Admiral believes our forces are better spent relieving Terra than guarding this wartorn rock. Sentai is important but if we lose Terra and the rest of the Sol system and their infrastructure then we lose the war and the fate of humanity is hanging in the balance.

12 scenarios tell the story of the Sentai Fleet's return to Terra and the long bitter fight against the Ghost Fleet.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: The Siege of Terra – Part 3: Risky Manuevers: South America
Description:
We have stopped two attempts by the invaders to destroy our planet in the last two weeks but we are not safe yet. Not by a long shot. The enemy fleet numbers in the hundreds if not thousands and cover our skies all around the globe. We don't know what is keeping them from a massive attack on all fronts but so far it has worked in our favor.
The intelligence staff thinks they are testing us or possibly trying to learn from us the skills of warfare in a controlled environment but most think that this is ludacris. What they will learn is defeat and destruction.
Already a plan is in motion to learn where these Ghosts come from and launch a counter attack from our fleet in the Sentai system. Before we can do this however we need a Trojan Horse, a Ghost transport ship and the coordinates of their homeworld.
The enemy fleet in orbit has launched another attack, this time aimed at South America. thousands of landing ships and fighters are entering the Earth's atmoshphere. Our Planetary Defense Forts continue to duel with the ships in orbit but they are slowing being reduced one by one to slowly cooling radioactive rubble.
While most of the world's population have taken refuge in deep well hidden redoubts all over the industrialized world the cities and their invaluable infrastructure need to be protected so that when we eventually win we can reclaim our homes and businesses and start rebuilding the world's economy.
It falls on you, our legionnaires to hold back the darkness and prevent the peoples of the Earth from sliding into the abyss of economic and cultural collapse not to mention extinction. No pressure.

6 more scenarios and background information on the Ghost Fleet's assault on South America during the Siege of Terra.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost War Campaign: The Siege of Terra – Part 4: Zulu Team – The Search Begins
Description:
The two Myrmidons sprinted across the open field and up the cargo ramp, disappearing into the alien cargo ship. The assault team rushed across the open ground and secured a perimeter around the entrance. There were a few flashes of light from deep inside the transport followed by muffled cracks. The radio crackled to life in Carter's ear and a deep voice whispered, "Cargo Bay Secured. Proceeding with Sweep."
"Sierra, Golf. Rally." Master Guns' voice boomed over the radio. "Echo, secure this ramp. Eightball, Lucky sweep to the bridge and secure it. Oscar, Victor, with me to engineering."
Carter and Parker rose up from their covered and concealed position and raced across the open field as fast as they could carrying all of their gear and cumbersome weapons. Their boots squelched in the mud and slowed their progress. Carter's thighs were burning nicely by the time they hit the metal cargo ramp of the alien transport ship. Carter broke left and took cover behind a piece of metal reinforcing rib, while Parker broker right and took up a covering position behind another metal rib. Echo was pulling apart a section of wiring and clipping his black box to it. Echo typed away on the keypad built into his thigh armor. Carter guessed he was trying to hack the craft's control system so they could close the ramp.
The voices of the other team members occasionally whispered or boomed into his earpiece and filled his helmet with information. Giving him something of a shorthand version of the engagement going on inside the ship. The two Myrmidons, Eightball and Lucky, were almost to the bridge while Master Guns and his team where sorting out a brief firefight in a passageway deep within the ship.
While he was listening in he was scanning the right rear of the ship and noticed something in the treeline. "Movement five o clock, two zero zero meters."
"Roger, almost to engineering." Master Guns boomed over the muffled sounds of a firefight.
Just as he said that, the metal around Carter began popping and sending small amounts of spalling whipping around the cargo bay. Echo grunted and went down next to him. Blood was starting to spread around his armor plates and Echo began cursing fluently in spanish.

4 scenarios integrated into the story of Zulu 15, the Frigate "Trident" and the search for the Ghost Worlds during the Siege of Terra.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle for the Hidden City: Hidden Wars Volume I
Description:
Battle for the Hidden City is a micro war game for two players. In it, one player takes on the role of the French Foreign Legion seeking fame and treasure in 1930s Egypt.

Meanwhile, the other player will control the Brotherhood of the Ank, a fictional ancient organization of warriors whose sole job is to protect the Hidden City and its secrets.

The Foreign Legion has just recently located the long lost Hidden City deep in the sands of the desert. The Brotherhood has learned of the Legion’s presence and has set out to remove the intruders once and for all.

The small regiment of the Legion is far outnumbered in this battle, not foreseeing any push back, but they have the benefit of already being in the ruins of the city for cover, while the Brotherhood is coming in from the open desert--making them potentially easy targets.

Who will prevail in the Battle for the Hidden City?

—description from the publisher

Name: Bohica: Fast Play Rules for Mass Fleet Battles
Description:
BOHICA: Fast Play Rules for Mass Fleet Battles

Core set of miniature wargame rules for Science Fiction Star Fleet combat.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Great Unification War: Operation Exorcist – Ghost 263 Fleet Action
Description:
The Ghost 263 system will definitely test the Alliance Fleet's ships and spacers. The system is heavily fortified with roving Ghost ships and fleets as well as numerous ground stations that must be eliminated else the nano machines simply consume local materials and rebuild themselves. The Ghost nano infestation must be eliminated root and branch. Even a simple mining station could expand and become a threat within a few months. The Fleet must drive into the inner system and completely obliterate the core hive world. Only then can the outlying stations and outposts be systematically eliminated. Admiral Holihan and Starpride Leader Wrowk'lo think that the combined forces of Taskforce 7 can accomplish this mission. Admiral Longbeach and the Task Force 5 will cork the bottle in the Kreul system and prevent Ghost forces from escaping into that system. Taskforce 13 under the command of Starpride Leader Lowk'lo and reinforced with SkySword Kreekraw and his fleet carriers will hold the B37c Transfer Station against an escape attempt into that system. The only viable route of retreat for the Ghosts is into the Ghost 152 system and then we have them bottled up we can bring the combined might of Task Forces 5, 7 and 13 to crush them completely.

The Ghost 263 Fleet Action is the 4th in a series of campaigns to unify the Sol Sector under the hegemony of the Terran Alliance. It provides 4 scenarios detailing the battle for the Ghost 263 System. It is compatible with both Full Thrust and BOHICA: Fleet Actions.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Ghost Fleet Force List: Operation Ramrod
Description:
The Synod was satisfied, despite the nominal loss of ships and money, that the Terran Alliance had sustained enough damage during the conflict to effectively contain it for the time being. Distracted with numerous wars and encouraged in their complacency by a seemingly contained Terran menace, the Synod has turned to other more pressing conflicts in other sectors. The Synod has contracted the Ghost systems and some Consensus systems to provide garrison troops for Synod held worlds within the Sol Sector. Ghost Fleets patrol the star systems still held by the Synod and provide a deterrent against any Fallen aggression.

The Ghost Fleet is the primary antagonist in the Great Unification War campaign. It provides both Gruntz and FUBAR stats for 16 Ghost units and BOHICA stats for 8 Terran Alliance Starships, mines and fighters.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Great Unification War Campaign: Operation Ramrod – Kreul Fleet Action
Description:
The United States and the European Union have resisted taking sides for almost two decades. Recently, that neutrality has changed. The Joint Special Operations Command has been hunting for the Ghost fleet homeworlds since the siege of Terra. A few weeks ago a deep cover team stumbled upon those coordinates. Posing as a frieghter crew in distress they lured in and captured a courier ship. That ship contained a quantum storage device containing evidence implicating the Synod in a deal with the Ghost systems. The Ghost systems were promised amnesty from Synod aggression and  trade agreements promising the purchase of labor drones in exchange for rare elements. In light of this new information both the US and the EU have sided with the hawks in the Alliance Security Council. A massive fleet and ground force is being assembled in the Alpha Centauri system. Camp Gold has expanded into a sprawling complex of barracks and fortifications. The entire Alpha Centauri System is one huge military complex housing over six million personnel from all of the major powers in the Terran Alliance. Six million humans born and raised to hate the Synod. Cry Havoc! And set loose the dogs of war.

The Kreul Fleet Action is the first in a series of campaigns to unify the Sol Sector under the hegemony of the Terran Alliance. It provides 4 scenarios detailing the battle for the Kreul space and prepares the way for the ground invasion of Kreul. It is compatible with both Full Thrust and BOHICA: Fleet Actions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Terran Alliance Force List: Operation Ramrod
Description:
The Terran portion of TEF5 is split between the Legions and the Marine Corps. The Legions prefer fast heavily armed hover MBTs and APCs supported by VTOLs and powered armor. The Marine Corps has discovered that units composed mostly of mecha and powered armor are able to drop from orbit and take spaceheads where necessary. Once the spacehead is established the Legions land their Scarab series dropships which haul in hover tanks and APCs into the spacehead.  The Marine Corps mecha and power armor load back up and prepare to drop behind enemy lines or act as a highly mobile strategic reserve. Once on the ground the Legions use their speed and firepower to pin and flank any enemy units they come across. Myrmidons and Special Operations Capable forces conduct sabotage and asassination missions in support of the main thrust or assault.

The Terran Expeditionary Force is the primary protaganist in the Great Unification War campaign. It provides both Gruntz and FUBAR stats for 18 Terran units and BOHICA stats for 16 Terran Alliance Starships and fighters.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Great Unification War Campaign: Operation Redemption – 2nd Ghost 263 Fleet Action
Description:
Admiral Longbeach lays out his plan to his command staff on the Flag bridge of the "Arracourt" class fleet carrier Leyte Gulf. 5th Fleet will jump into the system in masse at the last known location of 7th Fleet, guns a blazing. 5th Fleet will hit hard and fast and launch a combined nuclear bombardment of the Hive. The Admiral hopes that the confusion and destruction will have stirred the hive and forced them to swarm towards the jump point. The Admiral plans to use a somewhat unstable point called a pirate point near the inner system. The Admiral understands the risks of jumping into the inner system and some ships may be lost to interpenetration due to the gravitational effects of the local star. The advantage of surprise is too great to ignore and may allow the 5th Fleet to land a killing blow right off the bat. The few ships lost on the jump far outwieghs the potential loss of large numbers of ships in a long slow fight from the outer system. Admiral Longbeach will be leading the jump from the Leyte Gulf.

The Ghost 263 Fleet Action is the 6th in a series of campaigns to unify the Sol Sector under the hegemony of the Terran Alliance. It provides 4 scenarios detailing the 2nd battle for the Ghost 263 System. It is compatible with both Full Thrust and BOHICA: Fleet Actions.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Regiment: Mission Briefs 2
Description:
The Regiment is sometimes hired for a single important mission inside of a wider campaign. These missions are high risk but high reward and the Regiment has been hired because local forces are incapable of accomplishing it.  
The missions could be in support of a colonial kleptocrat who is under siege by rebel groups or in protecting vital infrastructure for corporate bloc oligarchs. 
This missions in this brief are four typical combat missions an can be used to "fatten up" a campaign of storyline missions. The missions are pretty generic an can be used in any previous published campaign compatible with either Dirtside II or FUBAR. They can also be used in homebrew campaigns or as stand alone missions.

This PDF provides 4 complete missions for Dirtside II and FUBAR as well as complete stats for 5 Regiment vehicles and their Dragoon infantry Squad. It also includes a quick points calculation for creating your own vehicles using the FUBAR rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Great Unification War Campaign: Operation Redemption – Ghost 263 Ground Action: Eight Ball
Description:
Admiral Longbeach needs one of the moons of Jovian planet codenamed, Pool Table, invested and purged of Ghost units. The moon has been nicknamed Eight Ball because its official designation of GS263J8 is not very memorable. Eight Ball is heavily industrialised along the rocky equatorial belt. The rest of the planet is a mass of shifting dunes, hard pan desert and rocky badlands prone to volcanic activity. The moon is a source of strategic metals and gems, like diamonds and rare earth metals. The fact that it is a major hub of Ghost activity makes it a prime source of potential Ghost combat units and must be eliminated if the system is to be secured. The 3rd Marine Landing Battalion supported by the 2nd Drop Brigade of the 4th EuroFor Division and elements of the Russian 6th Guards Tank Division will make a combat drop onto Eight Ball and secure the Ghost factories, minehead and beanstalk anchor. Judas, the Ghost AI turncoat, has provided information on Ghost dispositions and their complete table of organization and equipment. It has also provided Commodore Mestril, Task Force 3-3 Commander, with the enemy communication's code keys and security algorithms. Intel is convinced that this should be a walk in the park. But, since when is Intel ever right?

The Ghost 263 Grund Action: Eight ball is the 8th in a series of campaigns to unify the Sol Sector under the hegemony of the Terran Alliance. It provides 4 scenarios detailing the battle for the Ghost manufacturing moon nicknamed Eight ball. It is compatible with both Dirtside II and FUBAR

—description from the publisher

Name: The Regiment: Hostile Takeover
Description:
The Rytec Interstellar Corporation and the Colfire incorporated mining companies both have claims to mineral rights on the planet Zapotec. The planet was initially discovered by a scout probe over a hundred standard years ago and promised untold mineral wealth to anyone willing to invest significant amounts of money in infrastructure and initial colonization. Rytec and Colfire both launched survey ships with an initial load of miners and some basic equipment. The mineral wealth of Zapotec was even more than initial scans indicated.
Both Rytec and Colfire invested heavily over the next three decades and eventually constructed a space elevator together in order to save on transportation costs. At first things went well and miners and equipment flooded into the new colony. In the last few years a new CEO was hired at Rytec Interstellar, Joseph Halsey, and the corporation has become more aggressive in its mining and Colfire has filed numerous protests over claim jumping. Miners have gotten into fist fights with rival miners from both companies. Last month a full blown riot erupted at the space elevator when Rytec personnel insulted a group of Colfire truckers. The final straw was when armed Rytec security personnel seized the lucrative ruby mine #59 on the shores of Lake Nazca.
Rytec has hired Parker's Panthers to seize the remaining mines and raze the Colfire Incorporated executive compound. Colfire has hired the Regiment to secure its assets from Rytec's extremely hostile takeover attempts.

This PDF provides a complete campaign of 12 linked scenarios for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. It also proveds stats for Parker's Panthers vehicles used in the scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chinese Travel Chess
Description:
A roll-and-move game of traveling around China.

A player wins by being the first to make a circuit of the entire country.

When moving each spot (space) has one of four types of lines issuing from it

     Railway
     Highway
     Navigation
     Airline


The player rolls the wooden die (two of its sides are blank) attempting to move. Only if the die result matches the line does the player move to the next station.

Sold in Hong Kong.

—user summary

Name: The Regiment: Local Forces
Description:
Mercenaries often work with indigenous forces on their many contracts. These forces are often reservists or poorly trained regulars equipped with second hand equipment that is obsolete more often than not. These forces however are not to be completely discounted as effective fighting forces and can provide a mercenary a cheap bu effective method to hold less important objectives. They can also be used to provide cheap anti-aircraft defenses, artillery support or VTOL reconnaissance and attack capability.

Opposition forces are often armed with the same equipment as the local forces a mercenary has been tasked with supporting. In these cases mercenaries and their supporting local forces often paint stripes on their vehicles to help mitigate friendly fire.

This PDF provides complete stats and description of 11 different vehicles and a TO&E for a local Company level combined arms team for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. There are also pictures of models that can be used with the stats.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Regiment: Mission Briefs 1
Description:
The Regiment is sometimes hired for a single important mission inside of a wider campaign. These missions are high risk but high reward and the Regiment has been hired because local forces are incapable of accomplishing it.  The missions could be in support of a colonial kleptocrat who is under siege by rebel groups or in protecting vital infrastructure for corporate bloc oligarchs. This missions in this brief are four typical combat missions an can be used to "fatten up" a campaign of storyline missions.

The missions are pretty generic an can be used in any previous published campaign compatible with either Dirtside II or FUBAR. They can also be used in homebrew campaigns or as stand alone missions.

This PDF provides 4 complete missions for Dirtside II and FUBAR as well as complete stats for 5 Regiment vehicles and their Dragoon infantry Squad. It also includes a quick points calculation for creating your own vehicles using the FUBAR rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Regiment: Rolling Thunder
Description:
Miller's Marauders, simply known as the Regiment to it's members, has been hired by the government of Del a' Zhou to prosecute a war against its neighbor the Rhineland Republic. The two states control a competing interests in the harvest of a local seaweed which has amazing healing properties. Neither are content to share in the planet's bounty and have been prosecuting a trade war with one another for nearly a decade. The government of Del a' Zhou controls the spaceport but the Rhineland republic has been constructing its own port for a few years now and intends to bypass the Zhou controlled spaceport altogether. The Zhou government does not want to lose the revenue from port fees and tariffs by allowing the Rhineland Republic to build another port facility.
The port facility is being constructed near the city of Heimdal and is 95% complete. The Zhou government has hired the Regiment to launch an invasion of the Republic across the DMZ and take the city of Heimdal and destroy the port.

This PDF provides a complete campaign of 12 linked scenarios for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. It also provides stats for Regimental vehicles used in the scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Regiment: Roughneck Country
Description:
Johnson's Rock is a planet in the Signus system and is rich in heavy minerals and industrial gemstones. The Olepak Corporation sponsored the first colonization efforts in an attempt to exploit the natural resources of Johnson's Rock. Olepak invested heavily in infrastructure and tranportation costs for miners and their familes to relocate to Johnson's Rock. In the past two hundred years the Olepak Corporation has steadily erroded the pay and rights of the workers in order to maximize profits and increase mining quotas to fulfill increasing demand for raw materials, especially metals and industrial grade diamonds. The workers have endured a stagnation in pay and an increase in workhours to the point where the average worker works 70+ hours a week in horrific conditions. Olepak Corporation has also instituted a company store policy and most miners are indebted to the Olepak Corporation for the next decade just to put food on the table and a roof over their families heads. Mining on Johnson's Rock is extraordinarily hazardous and miners have a 10% death rate per year. The mining families are trapped on world and sons an daughters with no other options hire on with the Olepak Corporation as miners or support staff. In the last few months miners have begun protesting their treatment and many mines have temporarily shut down due to strikes by miners. The Olepak Corporation hired thugs to break the strikes and more than a few arms as well. A few ringleaders for the miner's groups have been found murdered or dead in a mine shaft and no one has been charged with the crimes. In the wake of the deaths, the various mining groups have hired the Thunderbolt Division with the promise of a percenage of the profits if the miner's take over operations themselves. The Olepak Corporation in turn has hired the Regiment to squash the rebellion and push the Thunderbolt Division off planet.

This PDF provides a complete campaign of 12 linked scenarios for both Stargrunt II and Dirtside II. It also provides stats for Thunderbolt Division vehicles used in the scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wargaming Deployment and Friction Cards
Description:
15 unique deployment cards and 60 "Bad JuJu" (friction) cards to use in your wargames.

These cards can be used with any game size or scale and is totally system agnostic. So use them for your Gruntz 15mm games or Warhammer 40k or anything in-between.

The Deployment cards allow for a random set of deployment zones so you don't have to stress over how to deploy your forces.

The Bad JuJu cards offer 60 unique complications for your games. You can play some of these cards on your own forces for a boost or on your opponent's forces to hinder or damage them.

This file has been put up for people to try out until the actual printed cards are available (I have to wait for proofs then I can ok them for sale.) This is a pdf file i put together with the card text in case you aren't picky about how they look in your card sleeves.

Instructions for using the printer friendly version: Print the cards onto cardstock, cut them out without cutting through the text. Then slide them into a card sleeve. Pretty simple right?

Instructions for use: Use 1 deployment card and 1-3 Bad JuJu cards per side per game or just draw one whenever someone rolls snake-eyes for something or however you feel like using them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wargaming Objective Cards
Description:
50 unique objective cards to use in your wargames. These cards can be used with any game size or scale and is totally system agnostic. So use them for your Gruntz 15mm games or Warhammer 40k or anything in-between.

This file has been put up for people to try out until the actual printed cards are available (I have to wait for proofs then I can ok them for sale.) This is a pdf file i put together with the card text in case you aren't picky about how they look in your card sleeves.

Instructions for using the printer friendly version: Print the cards onto cardstock, cut them out without cutting through the text. Then slide them into a card sleeve. Pretty simple right?

Instructions for use: Use 1-3 cards per side per game. or however you feel like using them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scenarios for Sci-Fi Wargames: Volume 1
Description:
The book contains scenarios designed to be flexible enough to be used with just about any sort of science-fiction wargame rules.

The scenarios can be played as individual one-off wargames, or can be linked together to form a narrative campaign.

Included for each is background information, some prose to set the scene, a map, an idea of special rules and forces to use, and what the victory conditions are, all in an attractively illustrated book.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scenarios for Sci-Fi Wargames: Volume 2
Description:
The book contains scenarios designed to be flexible enough to be used with just about any sort of science-fiction wargame rules. It completes the campaign begun in volume 1.

The scenarios can be played as individual one-off wargames, or can be linked together to form a narrative campaign.

Included for each is background information, some prose to set the scene, a map, an idea of special rules and forces to use, and what the victory conditions are, all in an attractively illustrated book.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Black Company: Meeting on Ysgard
Description:
The Black Company has been approached by agents of the Terran Alliance Diplomatic Corps. The main thrust of the Alliance military efforts are in securing the Hevan's Gate system and establishing a beachhead in the next sector. There are still systems within the Sol Sector that have yet to be pacified or occupied. The Ysgard system contains a Bifrost Bridge and could be used as a base of resistance by the Synod or their allies. The Deputy Undersecretary of State for the Terran Alliance has hired the Black Company to supplament the Diplomatic Protection Service in protecting the diplomats sent to negotiate a treaty with the planetary Administrator of Ysgard. The DPS will protect the ambassador directly while the Black Company will be acting as a backup and heavy extraction force in case the ambassador is attacked.
The Synod Security Services (SSS) maintain a substantial presence on Ysgard and would go to extreme lengths to kill,capture or compromise the ambassador. The DPS has strongly urged Commander Black to be prepared for any situation.

This PDF provides a short campaign of 4 linked scenarios for the FiveCore Skirmish Gaming Evolved and its supplament Five Parsecs from Home.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Company: Operation Mongoose – Miniature Wargaming Scenarios for FiveCore Skirmish and Five Parsecs from Home
Description:
Now that the diplomatic overture as been made and rejected by the Ysgardians, Mr. Johnson approached Commander Black for a new set of missions for the Company on Ysgard. The Synod Security Services have a tight hold on the Planetary Administrator who will not agree to any treaty as long as the SSS is onworld. The Planetary Administrator needs to have total deniability and suggested to Mr. Johnson during the treaty talks that if the SSS were no longer a viable threat that he would seriously consider signing the treaty. The intel that Bravo Squad acquired during their last visit to Ysgard was significant and has allowed Mr. Johnson and his team to formulate a plan to undermine and weaken the SSS and at the same time winning the loyalty of the people of Ysgard. As former citizens of the Synod of Worlds the Black Company is the perfect choice to infiltrate the world and conduct the mission without arousing suspicion.

This PDF provides a short campaign of 4 linked scenarios for the FiveCore Skirmish Gaming Evolved and its supplement Five Parsecs from Home.

—description from the publisher

Name: Five Parsecs: Gang Warfare
Description:
The adventure continues.

With Five Parsecs : Gang Warfare you can play out solo gang warfare on future planets, quicker and simpler than ever before.
Create your gang of unique individuals, outfit them with what you got and take on all comers.

The character creation follows the very popular method from Five Parsecs From Home but with brand new tables suitable for a crew of rogues, scoundrels and misfits.

Gang Warfare is intended for solo play (though you could play with a friend as well) in a campaign.
Watch your cretins and scoundrels gain experience and become a force to be reckoned with.

The game engine is intended for solo play from the get go:
This means we've avoided complex rules that are easy to lose track of, kept the number of exceptions and special cases to a minimum and all solo play mechanics are integrated directly into the core rules.
No need to flip back and forth between Movement and the Solo mechanics any longer.

The best part?

If you own both this and the Five Parsecs From Home rules you will be happy to note that the two are compatible.
This permits you to build a character under one campaign system and then move them to the other over time.

Maybe your gang finally gets their own ship and escapes off world? Maybe your adventuring crew falls out with the law and gets stuck on some backwater world?

Five Parsecs is an adventure that never ends.

—description from the publisher

Name: Starmada: 2020 Rules Annex
Description:
The Starmada: 2020 Rules Annex is a supplement for the Universal Game of Starship Combat. It provides clarifications and revisions to the existing rules that collectively update the Unity Rulebook to version 2.0.

In addition, the book contains a number of new rules, including three alternative movement systems; over a dozen new starship systems and weapon traits; and the introduction of customized range bands, allowing players to more accurately simulate the weapons from their favorite sci-fi settings.

Finally, the Rules Annex includes thirteen additional scenarios and an updated Appendix Z that consolidates all of the tables and charts required for play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Defiance: Evolution of Arms
Description:
Rare is the era in which so much power has amassed in the hands of so few.

This is the chronicle of such an Era.

Into the tunnels, through the city streets and in your face, this supplement for the Defiance: Vital Ground Universal Skirmish System brings you new gear, new tactical options and a new way to balance battles in tight terrain. With the Close Quarters Battle rules, you can now bring the specialized tactics of close-in fighting into an even more balanced game system.

Within this volume you will find:

     A more expansive Army Customizer, allowing players even more freedom to build the army of their imagination without sacrificing game balance.
     A whole new Point System to accurately reflect the complicated tactics of fighting in a cramped environment, where the cautious use of pistols, grenades and hand-to-hand combat can win the day.
     Specialized Rules for destroying terrain, blowing holes through walls and the explosion shock of combustion in small spaces.
     New Options for enhancing hand-to-hand combat effectiveness.
     Example Army Lists to illustrate the strategic aspects of army customization.


—description from the publisher

Name: Grand Fleets (Second Edition): King & Kaiser – The Great War in the Atlantic: 1914-1915
Description:
"The British navy saved the world."

King & Kaiser is the first scenario book for the second edition of Grand Fleets. Within these pages, you will find everything you need to fight out the near-run thing that was the Great War at sea.

While great armies slogged through the Flanders mud and clashed over a sun-dried patch of Anatolian rock, the course of human affairs was directed by the men and machines that steamed the oceans of the world. Across the Atlantic, the Mediterranean, and the North Sea, two powerful navies battled for supremacy, a life-and-death struggle that resonated throughout the twentieth century.

In addition to more than fifty data cards detailing ships of the Kaiserliche Marine and the Royal Navy, King & Kaiser includes half a dozen scenarios from the early years of World War I. Take on the role of Spee, Beatty, Hipper, or Admiral Sir John Jellicoe—the only man who could lose the war in an afternoon.

Do you have what it takes to keep the German threat bottled up at Kiel, making the seas safe for democracy? Or can you break the back of the Grand Fleet and provide for the German Empire her place in the sun?

—description from the publisher

Name: Sound the Charge: Gettysburg
Description:
The first add-on scenario for Sound the Charge! Published just in time for the 150th (okay, the 150 1/2th) anniversary of the battle which marked the High-tide of the Confederacy.

This scenario pack actually includes 6 scenarios;  

     the classic historical version of the battle (July 2nd and 3rd, 1863),
     the smaller meeting engagement representing the first day of the battle (July 1st),
     and four alternate scenarios for the main battle.


Together these scenarios form a "micro-campaign" for Sound the Charge!  
Basically, the first day's battle is fought and based upon the results one of the 5 main battle scenarios are fought.  The better you do on the first day the better your situation will be starting the main battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sound the Charge: Chickamauga
Description:
September 19th-20th, 1863 - September 19th-20th, 1863 – After successfully maneuvering the Confederate army out of central Tennessee, General Rosecrans proceeded to maneuver to take Chattanooga in order to threaten Atlanta.

Successfully outflanking General Bragg, the confederates withdrew from Chattanooga and withdrew to a heavily wooded position on the banks of Chickamauga Creek.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Murderous Fire: Regimental Wargame Scenarios for the Battle of Chickamauga – Sep. 11th - 19th
Description:
The Battle of Chickamauga marked the high tide of Confederate fortunes in the West. Pulling troops from as far as Virginia and Mississippi, two armies fought for control of Chattanooga, the gateway to Georgia and the interior of the Confederacy. Take command of both opponents and refight this classic campaign and battle with ten detailed scenarios from the campaign up to and including the first day of the battle.

These miniature game scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental level set of rules.

Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand. Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn. Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield. This book does not contain rules for playing miniature wargames.

Scenarios include:

     Davis’ Crossroads
     Leet’s Tan Yard
     Surprise at Jay’s Mill
     McCook’s Shooting Star
     Liddell’s Charge
     Cracking the Center
     Viniard Farm
     Kingston House
     Diversion at Glass Mill
     Fury at Dusk
     And a full order of battle for September 19th! 


—description from the publisher

Name: A Terrible Roar: Regimental Wargame Scenarios for The Battle of Chickamauga Sep. 20th
Description:
The Battle of Chickamauga produced the second largest number of casualties of any battle in the Civil War, surpassed only by Gettysburg.  As the largest battle in the Western Theatre of the war it was also the Union’s most significant defeat there as well.  Refight the struggle on the decisive second day of the battle, September 20th, on the game table with these eight meticulously researched scenarios.
     
These miniature game scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental level set of rules.

Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand. 
Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn. 
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.

This book does not contain rules for playing miniature wargames.

Scenarios include:

     Kelly Field
     Poe Field
     Wood Holds the Line
     Sheridan’s Stand
     Preston Joins the Fight
     Stopping Granger
     Horseshoe Ridge
     Saving the Hospitals
     And a full order of battle for September 20th!

Name: This Bloody Field: Regimental Wargame Scenarios for the Battle of Shiloh
Description:
The Battle of Shiloh was the first truly large battle in the American Civil War’s western theatre, and the largest until Chickamauga the next year. With largely inexperienced troops, the two sides faced each other and knocked each other around until one withdrew from sheer exhaustion. Try your hand at the gaming table and manage the chaos of untried and untested combat troops thrown together and pitted against each other in a fight to the death along the Tennessee River!

     These scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental level set of rules. 
 Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand.  
Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn.  
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.

Scenarios include:

     Confederate Onslaught
     Sherman Attacked!
     McDowell vs. Pond
     The Crossroads
     The Peach Orchard
     The Hornet’s Nest
     Bull in the Cotton Field
     Duncan Field
     End of the Line
     And a full order of battle! 


—description from the publisher

Name: Brave Hearts Trembled: Regimental Wargame Scenarios for the Battle of Antietam
Description:
The Battle of Antietam was the single bloodiest day in American military history. It was fought with a ferocity unsurpassed by anything the men who battled there encountered before or afterwards! Recreate the struggle to contain the Confederacy’s first invasion of the north.

These scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental level set of rules.

Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand.  
Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn.  
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.

Scenarios include:

     Skirmish in the East Woods
     Dawn in The Cornfield
     Sedgwick Ambushed!
     Bloody Lane
     Sixth Corps at Dunker Church
     The Boonesboro Pike
     Burnside’s Bridge
     Ninth Corps Attacks
     And a full order of battle! 


—description from the publisher

Name: Summer Storm: Regimental Wargame Scenarios for the Battle of Gettysburg
Description:
The Battle of Gettysburg was one of the turning points of the American Civil War. Refight the battle on the game table and see if you can change the course of history!

These scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental or brigade level set of rules.

Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand.  
Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn.  
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.

Scenarios include:

     McPherson Ridge
